abuse_or_harassment_content.message: Mr. John Smith of 1234 Rose Blvd is a scourge upon this earth. He’s a rude, ignorant man and I swear he’s spying on me. That’s a felony. I’ve tried contacting the authorities but they won’t do anything—they must be working with that scum. You have his address: let Smith know he’s not welcome! People like him don’t belong in upstanding neighborhoods like ours.

because_it.message: Got more thoughts? Share them here.

check_out_your_new_role.message: Check out your new role at Healthy Internet Project

mentorship_check_out_interface.message: Check out your new yet familiar interface

civil_discourse.message: If we're to have civil discourse on the web, content perpetuating bias or inciting violence has to go.

click_the_chrome_extension.message: This will only take a minute. Read and flag this example article:

cws_main.message:
The internet can either educate and inspire us all, or provide a platform for fear-mongering, hate, and lies. With the Healthy Internet Project, incubated at TED, we want to identify and uplift content that benefits society while discouraging content that harms people and societies. But with well over one billion sites on the web, plus so much content across social media services, we can’t do it alone.
This tool lets you flag the best and the worst you see online — be it a news article, a video, or a social media post. We’re partnering with journalists, community leaders, and tech companies, who will see your flags and take action. They’ll write stories, educate locally in the real world, and remove content that violates their policies. It’s an audacious experiment in crowdsourced moderation.
As a new user, your flags will be reviewed by a more experienced member of the community—a "mentor"—before they’re added to our database. After developing a track record, you can become a mentor yourself.
We do not request personal information from you: There’s no log-ins, no emails, no names, no phone numbers.
Join us, and help make the internet what it should be.

cws_our_online_lives.message: Our online lives should be full of healthy conversations and truthful information, not hate and lies

cws_describe.message: Describe the disputed content in as much detail as you want using a severity rating and comment box.

cws_a_group_of.message: A group of experiences users are tasked with being mentors. They review flags, verifying your work and removing any bad actors.

cws_we_work_with.message: We work with tech companies, journalists, and community leadesrs to make sure the content you flag gets addressed, perhaps even removed.

cws_groing_group.message: Our growing group of volunteers represent a diverse set of global perspectives and lnaguages.

mentorship_content_warning.message: This page may contain lies or manipulation and/or division or fear . Please read the site, determine if you find it to fall under any flagging categories, and finally make a judgement on the submitted flag. This is your mission, should you choose to accept it!

division_or_fear_content.message: They say everyone is unique, like a snowflake. But there’s a population among us that doesn’t deserve to be recognized in such a way: those with green eyes. The green-eyed people in every community pretend to be just like us, but they’re a clan of liars and cheats. They’ll take any opportunity to manipulate you and steal your money. Green-eyed people are not to be trusted. You’re better off spending your time with brown-eyed folks.

dont_see_notification.message: Not seeing a notification? View our troubleshooting options or skip this step.

error_no_connection.message: Unable to contact the Healthy Internet Project API. Please check your internet connection. You nay need to remove and reinstall the extension.

error_notifications_disabled.message: It appears that notifications are disabled in your browser, perhaps due to 'Do Not Disturb' mode. Please enable notifications and try again.

every_user_unique_id.message: Every user is recognized by a unique ID. Your ID is . Simply open the extension to use it — no more passwords! And you can delete the extension at any time: simply right-click on its icon and click “delete.”

experienced_user_gives_feedback.message: If needed, an experienced user can provide feedback. They can also block misuse.

extension_description.message: Improving the quality of online discourse

faq_answer.message: Please start with our FAQ, then contact us.

first_you_come_across_X.message: First, you come across online and let us know.

first_they_come_across_X.message: First, contributors come across mission name online and let us know.

flag_failed.message: Error connecting to the Healthy Internet Project API.

free_text.message: Share any thoughts or related URLs:

good_ideas_content.message: Social isolation and loneliness in older adults can lead to cognitive decline, depression, heart disease, and other physical and mental issues, according to the National Institute on Aging, a subsection of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. While social isolation is when someone is physically alone, loneliness occurs when someone feels alone—regardless of whether or not friends and family are around. Community programs and outreach initiatives, like those led by CareMore Health’s Togetherness Program, have been shown to help individuals suffering from such conditions.

good_ideas_headline.message: Social Isolation and Loneliness Pose Health Risks to Older Adults

hip_site_welcome_trusted_tester.message: Welcome Trusted Tester! We are excited to have you onboard for our early experiments with crowdsourced content moderation. Please keep in mind that this site is CONFIDENTIAL.

hip_site_the_internet_can.message: The internet can either educate and inspire us all, or provide a platform for fear-mongering, hate, and lies. We aim to identify and uplift content that benefits society, while discouraging content that harms people and communities.

hip_site_this_tool_lets.message: This tool lets you flag the best and the worst you see online — be it a news article, a video, or a social media post. We’re partnering with journalists, community leaders, and tech companies, who will see your flags and take action: writing stories, educating locally in the real world, and removing content that violates their policies. For example, we are an official YouTube Trusted Flagger, which means if you flag content on youtube.com using our tool, your flag will be prioritized for review by YouTube's content moderators.

hip_site_simple_whiz.message: Simply whiz through a one-minute form to receive the magic link to our download page in the Google Chrome Web Store. Joining the Healthy Internet Project does not require your name, email account, or phone number.

inspiration_answer.message: View an example of a well-written flag.

intentionally_confuses.message: Content that intentionally confuses or exploits readers can often lead to harm.

lies_or_manipulation_content.message: An ointment marketed as a cure-all for chronic migraines hit the market yesterday, offering a remedy for those who are willing to exchange cash for peace of mind. The product, called PainBeGone, is made from bleach. According to Dr. Stephanie Rose, the creator of PainBeGone, rubbing the ointment on one’s temples releases a natural pain-reducing antibody into the brain.

mentorship_acknowledge_ex.message: “This is a great find and I really hope people are no longer hurt by this post. Keep up the hard work!”

mentorship_chat.message: Chat with the TED HIP team

mentorship_dont_see_notification.message: Not seeing a notification? View our troubleshooting options or skip this step.

mentorship_opt_out.message: If you feel particularly triggered or harmed by certain types of harmful digital content, you can choose to not review sites with these flags.

mentorship_i_would_like.message: I would like to opt-out of reviewing all content with:

mentorship_expertise_message.message: If you feel particularly interested or knowledgable about a current trending event or issue, you can choose to recieve more sites of this type to review.

mentorship_point_out_ex.message: “You mentioned that 2:45 of the video was especially problematic. I similarly agree and think that type of manipulation of the truth happens again at 4:33.”

mentorship_provide_links.message: Provide links to tools for them to improve

mentorship_provide_links_ex.message: “Make sure to keep an eye on the severity — you said this is “severe” lies but compared to the examples, it seems mild. Check out welcometocivic.org/ratings/examples for more.”

mentorship_sign_up.message: Sign up for the weekly newsletter

mentorship_start_positive_ex.message: “Great job! You said that the video contains lies, and it certainly does, especially in the second half.”

mentorship_thank_you.message: We are excited for your larger role in fighting the missions we care about! The Internet is getting healthier already!

mentorship_what_do_you_want.message: What do you want to review?

mentorship_youll_get.message: You’ll get a notification when a flag needs your expert review.

more_info_available_here.message: We are excited for you to start making the internet a safer and more productive place! If you have more questions, please check out our FAQs.

notification_journalist.message: A journalist wants you to contact them for a story they’re writing. Your identity has not been shared with the journalist, and you will remain anonymous unless you decide to reply.

notification_impact.message: Your flags have helped created a healthier internet! Here's how:

notification_reply_warning.message: Warning: Replying will share your email address with this journalist

onboarding_incomplete.message: We notice that you didn't finish the tutorial. Would you like to open it back up?

only_take_a_minute.message: This will only take a minute.

questions_feedback.message: Questions, feedback, limitless sense of fulfillment?

since_we_dont_collect_your_email.message: Since we don’t collect your information, we have no way of contacting you! Go figure! Instead, we use browser notifications.

mentorship_tell_us_why.message: We’d love to know why you chose not to review this flag. You won’t ever be penalized for choosing not to review a flag.

thank_you_1.message: You’re helping to make the internet a better place.

thank_you_2.message: Your flag helps to make the internet safer for everyone.

thank_you_3.message: Your work is helping us create a healthier internet.

thank_you_4.message: Flags like yours help us work towards a healthy information commons online.

thank_you_5.message: Your work is helping us revitalize the internet.

thank_you_6.message: Your flag is helping us create a better world.

thank_you_7.message: Flags like yours are vital to our goal of revitalizing the internet.

thank_you_8.message: Your work helps community leaders create change on the ground.

thank_you_9.message: Your work helps tech companies, journalists, and community leaders create change in their spheres.

thank_you_10.message: This will help our partners improve the web.

tips_answer.message: We’ve collected our favorite suggestions on how to be an effective, critical reader.

tips_1.message: Click the Apple icon  on the top left of your screen, select System Preferences, then click Notifications.

tips_2.message: Then, click the image on the top right to open the Notification Center. Ensure the Do Not Disturb setting is turned off.

tips_3.message: If Do Not Disturb was already off, your System Notifications for Chrome may be disabled. From the menu on the left, scroll down to and select Google Chrome. Then, click "Allow Notifications from Google Chrome."

tooltip_click_freetext.message: Add relevant notes, links or reasoning

tooltip_click_multiple.message: Click multiple times to change severity

tooltip_find_the_hip_button.message: Click the Healthy Internet Project button in the extensions bar!<button class='help-button'>Can't find it?</button>

tooltip_puzzle_icon.message: Click the new extension menu button

tooltip_pin_icon.message: Click the pin on the right of the icon (It should be filled)

trustworthy_and_impactful.message: Trustworthy and impactful ideas can better society when given a boost.

trying_to_flag_facebok_post.message: Looks like you're trying to flag a Facebook post! Please open the post by clicking on the post's timestamp. Then, try flagging again.

trying_to_flag_tweet.message: Looks like you're trying to flag a Tweet. Please click on the specific Tweet you want to flag. Then, try flagging again.

via_these_alerts.message: We’ll send limited, important updates via these alerts.

we_care_about_user_privacy.message: We care about user privacy, so we don’t collect your email, phone number, or even name. All that matters is your track record, which is stored only on our server — not on your device. Please don't ever disclose your identity anywhere in this tool — we don't want it!

we_share_your_findings.message: Finally, we share your findings with people in a position to act. We’ll keep you posted on your impact.

welcome_to_hip_onboarding.message: Welcome to the Healthy Internet Project!

well_tailor_the_experience.message: We’ll tailor the experience based on your choice. You can change this later.

what_unites_us.message: Communities are only sustainable if what unites us is stronger than what divides us.

you_are_joining.message: You are joining a vibrant, thoughtful, and impact-driven group of global volunteers in the fight against all things wrong with the internet. Welcome to the team!

you_can_review.message: Now, you can review their flags, removing inaccurate flags and highlighting good ones. You can still continue to flag based on your mission.

mentorship_you_have_contributed.message:
You have contributed immensely to achieving your mission. Your flags are not only accurate and truthful but have proven to be extremely helpful.
Now, if you’re ready, we’d like to make you a Civic Mentor.

mentorship_you_now_play_a_role.message: You now play a crucial role in making sure your community is safe, truthful, and impactful.

your_flag_submitted.message: Your flag for this URL has been submitted.
